The Serbian national airline operated a total of 5,203 flights from the airports in Belgrade, NiÅ¡, and Kraljevo, up 6.8 per cent compared to July 2023, in scheduled flights. BoÅ¡ko RupiÄ‡, General Manager Commercial and Strategy at Air Serbia, proudly stated, "Considering that by June last year, we had expanded our network with more than 20 new destinations, July 2023 was a record month so far in terms of the number of passengers carried and flights operated. This year, we have exceeded that result, which is a clear indicator that the choice of destinations was good and that passengers need to have greater choice when travelling. In the first seven months of 2024, we carried 2,427,811 passengers on scheduled and charter flights, which is a 9.26 per cent increase year over year." ğŸŒ **ğ—§ğ—¼ğ—½ ğ——ğ—²ğ˜€ğ˜ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—®ğ˜ğ—¶ğ—¼ğ—»ğ˜€ ğ—¶ğ—» ğ—ğ˜‚ğ—¹ğ˜†:** - ğ—ªğ—²ğ˜€ğ˜ğ—²ğ—¿ğ—» ğ—˜ğ˜‚ğ—¿ğ—¼ğ—½ğ—²: Valencia, Malaga, Palma de Mallorca - ğ—˜ğ˜‚ğ—¿ğ—¼-ğ— ğ—²ğ—±ğ—¶ğ˜ğ—²ğ—¿ğ—¿ğ—®ğ—»ğ—²ğ—®ğ—»: Larnaca, Heraklion, Istanbul, Izmir, Corfu, Rhodes - ğ—”ğ˜€ğ—¶ğ—®: High demand for flights to Tianjin, China A huge thank you to our passengers for choosing Air Serbia! We're committed to providing more choices and excellent service on all your journeys. ğŸŒŸ #AirSerbia #Aviation #RecordBreaking #PassengerGrowth #Travel #AviationNews

âœˆï¸ Our â€œTake Offâ€ summer interns visit Air Serbia Technical and learn more about one of the key departments for every airline Our colleague Marko Beronja, Maintenance Planning Manager of Air Serbia Technical held a workshop for â€œTake Offâ€ summer interns. At the workshop, our interns had the opportunity to learn how aircraft are constructed, how they fly and how their main parts work. They also learned about the way Air Serbia Technical is organized, how new aircraft are introduced into the fleet, and how aircraft are painted. âœ”ï¸ After the workshop, the interns visited a small and a large hangar, where they learnt about how the work in the hangars is organized. A special treat was the visit to one of our regional ATR aircraft, which is currently undergoing maintenance, where the interns had the opportunity to enter the cockpit. This visit organised by Air Serbia HR team in cooperation with Technical was extremely educational and inspiring for our interns, providing them with an insight into the daily activities and challenges faced by our technical team. ğŸ€ We look forward to future workshops and continued successful cooperation! #TakeOff #AirSerbia #SummerPractice #Technical #Aviation #Training #Interns

ğŸŒŸğŸ‘©âœˆï¸ In the Air Serbia cockpit, there are ever more women in the positions of captain and first officer. Today we present to you captains Vanja MarÄeta and Neetu RakiÄ‡! âœˆï¸ Vanja MarÄeta is the first female captain in Air Serbia's ATR fleet and the first woman pilot to earn this title at the Serbian national airline. She started her career in 2016 as the first officer on the Boeing 737-300, and since 2022 she has been the first officer in the ATR fleet. On 9 July 2024, Vanja became a captain in the ATR fleet and made her first flight in her new role on 14 July 2024, on the route between Belgrade and Budapest. ğŸ›« âœˆï¸ Neetu RakiÄ‡ recently completed several months of successful training to become captain of the Airbus A330-200 wide-body aircraft. This made her the first female captain in Air Serbia's long-haul traffic, after flying aircraft of the Airbus A320 family. ğŸŒ We are proud of our female captains who push the boundaries and set new standards in aviation! âœˆï¸ğŸ’ª #AirSerbia #ErSrbija #WomenInAviation #FemalePilots #FlyAirSerbia

ğŸ“¢ Today at Air Serbia we had a great working breakfast with our interns from the "Take Off" program! ğŸš€ We were pleased that our interns had the opportunity to meet and talk with our CEO Jiri Marek and GM People and Performance Milica NetkoviÄ‡. ğŸŒŸ During breakfast, interns asked questions about: âœˆï¸ Company strategy and trends in the aviation industry ğŸ“ˆ How Air Serbia responds to those trends ğŸ‘¨ğŸ’¼ Professional development of our CEO and his way to the top ğŸ“ Tips for the career development of our students Milica NetkoviÄ‡ also shared: ğŸ’¼ Company values and way of functioning ğŸ” Your professional path and useful career advice We would like to thank our leaders for the inspiring talks and all the interns for their active participation! We look forward to further cooperation and your progress. ğŸ’ª #ErSrbija #AirSerbia #TakeOffProgram #Interns #Leadership #Career #AviationIndustry

ğ—”ğ—œğ—¥ ğ—¦ğ—˜ğ—¥ğ—•ğ—œğ—” ğ—–ğ—”ğ—¥ğ—¥ğ—œğ—˜ğ—¦ ğ—§ğ—ªğ—¢ ğ— ğ—œğ—Ÿğ—Ÿğ—œğ—¢ğ—¡ ğ—£ğ—”ğ—¦ğ—¦ğ—˜ğ—¡ğ—šğ—˜ğ—¥ğ—¦ ğ—¦ğ—œğ—¡ğ—–ğ—˜ ğ—¦ğ—§ğ—”ğ—¥ğ—§ ğ—¢ğ—™ ğŸ®ğŸ¬ğŸ®ğŸ°ğŸ‰âœˆï¸ Today, 8 July, Air Serbia proudly carried its 2 millionth passenger in 2024! We reached this significant milestone 11 days earlier than last year when we accomplished it on 19 July. Since the beginning of the year, we've operated 22,155 flights, an increase of 1,713 flights compared to 2023, when we had performed 20,442 flights by this date. â¡ï¸â€œAir Serbia is making better progress with each passing year, as evidenced by the companyâ€™s results. In 2022, we carried our 2 millionth passenger on 5 October, and last year we managed to do it two and a half months sooner, on 19 July, and now we have shortened this timeline even further and today, we carried our 2 millionth passenger in 2024. Despite the challenges the aviation industry is facing this summer, we are trying to offer our passengers the best service and be a reliable partner on their trips. The trust our passengers place in us, by choosing the Serbian national airline as their carrier, proves that our dedication has been recognized, which makes us very happy and proudâ€, said Air Serbia CEO Jiri Marek. A huge thank you to our dedicated team and loyal passengers for making this possible. Here's to many more successful flights and happy travelers! ğŸŒŸ #AirSerbia #FlyAirSerbia #Milestone #Aviation #2MillionPassengers #CustomerSuccess

âœˆï¸ğ—¡ğ—²ğ˜„ ğ—¿ğ—²ğ—°ğ—¼ğ—¿ğ—±ğ˜€ ğ—³ğ—¼ğ—¿ ğ—¦ğ—²ğ—¿ğ—¯ğ—¶ğ—®ğ—» ğ—»ğ—®ğ˜ğ—¶ğ—¼ğ—»ğ—®ğ—¹ ğ—°ğ—®ğ—¿ğ—¿ğ—¶ğ—²ğ—¿ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡¸ ğ—¢ğ—©ğ—˜ğ—¥ ğŸ°ğŸ¯ğŸµ,ğŸ¬ğŸ¬ğŸ¬ ğ—£ğ—”ğ—¦ğ—¦ğ—˜ğ—¡ğ—šğ—˜ğ—¥ğ—¦ ğ—¢ğ—¡ ğ—”ğ—œğ—¥ ğ—¦ğ—˜ğ—¥ğ—•ğ—œğ—”â€™ğ—¦ ğ—™ğ—Ÿğ—œğ—šğ—›ğ—§ğ—¦ â¡ï¸ In June 2024, Air Serbia carried 439,051 passengers on scheduled and charter flights, which is 16,688 passengers more compared to the same month last year. From the airports in Belgrade, NiÅ¡, and Kraljevo, the Serbian national carrier operated 4,466 flights in June, which is 3% more compared to the same month in 2023. In this way, Air Serbia broke its June record when it comes to passengers carried and flights operated, set in 2023. ğŸ—º Air Serbiaâ€™s most popular destinations in June were Zurich, Paris, Barcelona, Amsterdam, and Frankfurt in Western Europe, Podgorica and Tivat in the region, while in the Euromediterranean zone, the most popular flights were to Larnaca, Istanbul, and Athens. In June, there was also high demand for flights to New York, in North America. #FlyAirSerbia #AirSerbia #June #Record

ğŸš€ Exciting times at Air Serbia! Starting 1 July, 24 talented students and recent graduates have embarked on our â€œTake-offâ€ practice program, spanning various departments until 30 August. At a warm welcome ceremony, they met our HR team, learned about our airline, signed their first business contracts, and took some fun photos. The interns come from diverse academic backgrounds including transport and traffic engineering, mechanical engineering, economic and business, electrical engineering, law, management in engineering, political sciences, and philology. They'll be gaining hands-on experience in units such as Flight Operations Training, Network Operating Centre, Crew Planning and CrewControl, and many more. We're thrilled to support these bright minds and look forward to their contributions. Hereâ€™s to a productive and enriching summer! ğŸŒŸâœˆï¸ #AirSerbia #Internship #CareerTakeoff #FutureLeaders
